name: Popular Tea Cakes Workshop
description: Popular Tea Cakes Workshops We cover a variety of  of 5 various tea cakes that we teach from scratch. We use only the best of ingredients and source everything locally. We teach you how to bake cakes and the frostings that go with it, in a tradiotional method. Its a hands on experince and we provide the students with hand outs which they will be taking home with them.-Banana Cake with Dark Chocolate Chips-Sticky Toffee Date Cake with Salted Caramel Sauce -Carrot Cake with Cream Cheese Frosting -Orange Pound Cake Looking forward to baking the world a better place!

name: Eggless Cake Making Workshop
description: Weclome to our Eggless Cake Making Workshop!We teach you to bake your cakes to perfection with giving you a product thats so flavourful, you don't feel the absence of egg at all.What will you learn?-Eggless Vanilla Sponge -Eggless Chocolate Sponge -Couverture Chocolate Ganache -Salted Caramel -Whipping of Organic fresh cream (sourced from France) -Flavour Pairings (Caramel Chocolate Cake, Black Forest Cake, Classic Chocolate Cake , Fresh Cream Fruit Cake ).We make sure you embrace the art of baking and use the skills you will learn to best use.

name: Cheesecake Workshop
description: This class is for all the cheescake lovers. Here at Flourish, we teach you a variety of cheesecakes that range with technique and flavour. Tips, tricks and methods pertaining to perfecting your cheesecake is covered in this class. A variety of 3 cheesecakes is taught.-Baked New York Cheesecake -Frozen Fruit Cheesecake -Cotton Cheesecake (Japanese Cheesecake) All information regarding the baking of these widely different cheesecake will be passed on to our students. We provide you with all the ingredients, tools and know-how for the class including a handout which you will be taking home. Along with that, you will be taking the lovely cheesecakes you've made at the class, back home to your friends and family. Join us for a fun filled, cheese-centric workshop! Cheers!

name: Brownie Workshop
description: Join us in  baking two versions of a delectable Brownie. Everything we teach you is made from scartch. Tips, tricks and techniques required to perfecting your brownie is thoroughly taught at this class. Various ways to spice up your brownie with toppings and what combination works best! You will learn-An Eggless Brownie A Brownie with Egg Both versions of the brownie is fanatstic and you can't chose which one you like more!All ingredients are provided to you including the tools! We provide you with handouts as well which you will be taking home with you along with the brownies youve made yourself! Looking forward to a delectable class filled with chocolate and fun!

name: Food Nerd Festival - Immersives 2024 - Bangalore: All Day Pass
description: Food Nerd Festival is a celebration of all things food created by Goya & Edible Issues in collaboration with Two Tigers & Co.! Whether you're a chef, foodie, flavour geek, or love to nerd out over the latest culinary trends and techniques, the Food Nerd Festival is your jam.With 4 workshops centred around the basic cooking elements, these immersives will leave you with an elevated culinary game.Salt by Chef Gautam & Bala (@gonzogarbanzo & @saltycuredpigs) (11-12:30)Guided Overview & History Of Preservation TechniquesExploring Techniques Of Pickling & Preserving In India & Around The WorldUnderstanding Curing Salts & The Science Behind ThemExpert Tips On Mastering Salt, Time, & FermentationLive Demonstration Of A Traditional Pickling TechniqueLive Demonstration Of A Meat Curing TechniqueRecipes For Pickling & Curing Bacon At HomeFat by Heena Punwani (@tiffintales, founder of Maska Bakery) (1:00-2:30)Cracking The Code Of Baking Theory: The Science Behind ItThe History Of Fats In CookingUnderstanding Different Fats In Indian BakingCookie Tasting Session Showcasing Different FatsOil Vs. Ghee: Flavor ShowdownLive Fat-Washing Cocktail DemoAcid by Payal Shah (@kobofermentery) (3:00-4:30)Exploring Indian Vinegars & Its Usage In Indian Cooking & HistoryLive Demonstration Of Vinegar Making.Breakdown Of The Science Behind The TechniqueA Vinegar-Tasting Experience of 5 vinegars.Hands-On Shrub-Based Drink MakingHeat by Chef Gresham Fernandes (@greshamfernandes) (5:00-6:30)Discover the Secrets of Heat SourcesUncover the chemistry behind how heat worksLearn the wonders of wood-fired cookingPro techniques for smoking foodUsing heat to create different textures: dry jerky vs fish roast. Disclaimer: Programming is subject to change, please watch out for an official email a few days before the actual workshop.

name: New India Lodge -1950. A Food Theatre Experience in Bangalore
description: Step into the Past, Dine in a Story: Join the Multi-Lingual, Immersive Theatrical Feast! 🍽️ 🎭Experience "New India Lodge: Athithi Devo Bhava" - A Journey Beyond TimeWritten by Shubhra ChatterjiDirected by K V Divya RaniFood by The Nommers - Home Cuisine CollectiveProduced by paChaak Productions Are you ready for an unforgettable culinary voyage through the pages of history? Calling all Luru Foodies to an extraordinary event that will whisk you away to a bygone era and a tantalizing journey of flavors!🌐 Witness the Unseen, Dine with Our Characters: Your Personal Invitation to the 1940's 🌐Picture this: You step into a world where reality blurs with fiction, guests merge with actors, and your dinner is transformed into an enchanting theatrical adventure. Welcome to "New India Lodge: Athithi devo Bhava," an immersive play that takes you to Independence-era India.🚪 Enter the New India Lodge, a secret locationAs you cross the threshold, you'll be transported back to the 1940s. No longer just a guest, you'll become a character in this captivating narrative.🍽️ Taste the HistorySavor a meticulously curated meal, each dish representing a different region of India. The flavors of Gujarat, Kerala, Punjab, Karnataka, and more come together in a culinary symphony.🎭 Become Part of the StoryFrom the Bohri & Gujarati tradesman to the Malyali family to the Punjabi bride, every character has a tale to tell. Interact with them, uncover their secrets, and immerse yourself in their lives.🔮 Unveil Hidden NarrativesEngage in conversations enter world of intrigue and charm. Who's a fellow guest, and who's a performer? Only time will reveal the truth.🎉 Brought to you by paChaak Productions, India's first Immersive Dining Experience curatorsThis exclusive event is an innovative collaboration between your love for food and your thirst for immersive experiences. Get ready to be delighted, engaged, and transported in ways you've never imagined!🎟️ Get Your Tickets NowSecure your spot at this one-of-a-kind event that combines history, drama, and culinary artistry. Limited seats available – don't miss your chance to be part of New India Lodge: Athithi Devo Bhava.📣 Join Us in Rewriting History Through a Magical Journey of Food and Stories! 📣InstructionsHeads up: Our secret location will be shared 24hrs prior to the show. Comfy shoes for the short walk, but once inside, it’s socks or barefoot to keep our vintage floors shining! 🧦✨Feel free to come dressed in 1950s Style, Be Part of the Story

name: Rooting For Tubers Festival
description: Get ready, Bangalore! Rooting for Tubers is back and better than ever. This year’s festival brings you an exciting mix of food, culture, and nature, all wrapped up in the humble yet powerful tuber. It’s a fun, family-friendly day out, co-curated by Spudnik Farms and culinary creatives, to celebrate the vibrant world of tubers. Come with your friends, family, or even solo, and immerse yourself in a one-of-a-kind experience exploring flavours, traditions, and sustainability!Whether you're a food enthusiast, an eco-conscious eater, or someone looking for a relaxed picnic-style festival, Rooting for Tubers will leave you inspired and hungry for more!What’s in store:15+ Community & Market StallsExplore diverse stalls featuring local farmers, producers, and communities, all sharing unique tuber varieties and other farm-fresh produce. Discover exciting new ways to cook with tubers, support small-scale farmers, and stock up on your favourite finds at the market.  Interact and meet various tuber growing communities from across India!Culinary Stalls & Live CookingWatch chefs in action as they cook up delicious tuber-inspired dishes! Learn from the best as they explore tubers in creative and sustainable ways, showcasing the potential of these crops in modern cooking.Workshops & TalksLearn from experts in hands-on workshops, including fermentation, traditional cooking methods, and nutrition. Engage in conversations around biodiversity, sustainable food systems, and the cultural significance of tubers, while interacting with both culinary professionals and farmers.Art Installation & Tuber DisplayDelve into the artistic side of tubers through a collaborative art installation, featuring a colourful display of various indigenous tuber varieties. Discover the beauty and biodiversity of tubers while learning about the role they play in climate resilience and food security.

name: ALT EFF 2024 x Courtyard Koota
description: Since the dawn of time, storytelling in community has shaped our mindset, our outlook and ultimately, our behavior. With record heat, oscillating droughts & floods, fires, melting glaciers (and ... you know the rest) our current narrative needs some course correcting.All Living Things Environmental Film Festival (ALT EFF) is back for a 5th edition, pan-India cultural event. Join us at Courtyard Koota for a unique evening of cinema, art & community. Watch award-winning global films on regeneration, activism, resilience and hope and engage in conversations with India’s most inspiring change-makers. Let’s restore the narrative of stewardship, together. All are welcome!PROGRAM:27th November, Wednesday6:30 - 6:45 PM : Some Thoughts on the Common Toad6:45 - 7:45 PM : A Flaming Forest7:45 - 8:30 PM: Q & A with A Flaming Forest and Discussion29th November, Friday6:30 - 7:00 PM : Tomorrow, the Burning Heavens7:00 - 8:00 PM : Miles Away 8:00 - 8:45 PM : ALT EFF Voices (With prompts and select curation provided by us, this is an open-mic for audiences to)PROGRAM DETAILS: Some Thoughts on the Common Toad (G. Anthony Svatek | USA | 10 mins 37 secs | English | 2023)A cine-collage manifesto inspired by George Orwell’s essay, with Tilda Swinton narrating. The film uses a blend of images and sound to highlight the common toad as a symbol of natural beauty amidst environmental and political decay. It contrasts the elegance of nature with contemporary issues, urging viewers to reconsider their relationship with the environment and appreciate its beauty and significance.A Flaming Forest (Salman Javeed, Satya Ambasta, Vivek Sangwan | India | 48 mins 27 secs | Kannada, English | 2024)Exclusionary conservation practices in the Biligiri Rangaswamy Temple (BRT) Tiger Reserve have displaced Soliga adivasis from the forests they have historically inhabited. The film documents their intimate relationship with the forest, displacement induced loss and resistance against such policies, calling for an alternative vision to conservation.Tomorrow, the Burning Heavens (Max Bloching | Germany | 22 mins 06 secs | German | 2024)This short film explores the 1560s` ‘Little Ice Age’ and its apocalyptic fears, illustrated in hand-coloured woodblock prints. The film juxtaposes these historical anxieties with modern-day artificial winter landscapes in the Alps, created for skiing resorts. By merging past and present, it examines how image-making, technology, and faith interact amidst environmental crises, reflecting on our evolving perceptions of nature and climate change.Miles Away (Megha Acharya | India | 50 mins | Bundeli, Hindi | 2023)The film follows the journey of three women who work at a brick kiln on the outskirts of a city in North India, in the midst of extreme rains and a global pandemic. What unfolds is a story of mobility, debt and the everyday lives of the caste-oppressed women, whose labour is both crucial and too often invisible, in the story of a rapidly urbanising global India.

description: Since the dawn of time, storytelling in community has shaped our mindset, our outlook and ultimately, our behaviour. With record heat, oscillating droughts & floods, fires, melting glaciers (and ... you know the rest) our current narrative needs some course correcting.All Living Things Environmental Film Festival (ALT EFF) is back for a 5th edition, pan-India cultural event. Join us at MEDAI for a unique evening of cinema, art & community. Watch award-winning global films on regeneration, activism, resilience and hope and engage in conversations with India’s most inspiring change-makers. Let’s restore the narrative of stewardship, together. All are welcome!PROGRAM:4th December, Wednesday2:00 -2:20 PM : Batsies2:20 - 2:40 PM : Covered in mud, buried under myths2:40 - 3:00 PM : Immaculate3:00 - 3:30 PM : Discussion/Sharing circle3:30 - 3:45 PM : Requiem for a Whale3:45 - 9:00 PM : The Giants6th December, Friday11:00 - 11:15 AM : ABBA11:15 - 11:30 AM : Some Thoughts on the Common Toad11:30 - 12:20 PM : A Flaming Forest12:20 - 1:00 PM : Q&A with A Flaming Forest (TBC)1:00 - 1:20 PM : Akunthit1:20 - 1:35 PM : Wild Summon1:35 - 2:15 PM : Seed Stories2:15 - 3:00 PM : Crisis of Consumption: India’s Overwhelming Waste Problem and What We Can Do About It by Consumers for Sustainability 3:00 - 3:20 PM : Burnt Country3:20 - 4:30 PM : Nenets vs Gas4:30 - 5:00 PM : ALT EFF Voices With prompts and/or select curation provided by us, this is an open-mic for audiences to express themselvesPROGRAM DETAILS:Batsies (Liz Unger | USA | 15 mins 22 secs | English | 2023)Batsies is an experimental short documentary about two wildlife biologists, Sara Weaver and Sarah Fritts, who challenge the stigma surrounding bats. Based in Texas, these quirky, tattooed women tackle cutting-edge bat research, focusing on threats from wind turbines. Despite the crucial role bats play in agriculture, their public image has worsened since COVID-19. The film highlights their unique friendship and dedication to saving these misunderstood creatures.Covered in mud, buried under myths: Red sand boa illegal trade (Shatabdi Charkraborti | India | 13 mins 32 secs | English, Hindi | 2024)Immaculate (Ningjing Wang | China, UK | 15 mins 40 secs | Chinese, English | 2024) In rural China, ecologist Amaël Borzée spends five years listening to the fading calls of Chinese immaculate tree frogs. When filmmaker Ningjing Wang, a lifelong frog enthusiast, joins him, they unite to uncover the secrets of this elusive species. Their journey reveals the shared struggles of the frogs and rural communities. Together, they strive to secure a future for these endangered amphibians and their environment.Requiem for a Whale (Ido Weisman | Israel | 15 mins 27 secs | Hebrew | 2022)On a stormy night in early 2021, a beached whale washes ashore at Nitzanim Beach, Israel. The film documents the whale’s burial and features phone calls between the director and the witnesses: a photographer, a news reporter, and a Bedouin tractor driver. The encounter with the whale’s corpse evokes the witnesses` thoughts about the dialogue between death and life.The Legend of Goldhorn (Lea Vucko | Slovenia | 13 mins 35 secs | No Dialogue | 2022) A heartbroken hunter, driven by grief and madness, ventures into the mountains, and goes against the mythical power of nature. Haunted by visions of his lost love, he is led by a shadowy guide to hunt the mythical Goldhorn, which ultimately leads to his demise. This 13-minute, dialogue-free film, inspired by Slovenian folklore, explores themes of greed and our relationship with nature, enhanced by a traditional Slavic musical score.Crying Glacier (Lutz Stautner, Philipp Becker | Germany, Switzerland | 14 mins 13 secs | English | 2023)The louder the glacier, the stronger the melt. The creaking, cracking and rippling is the voice of impermanence. Sound artist Ludwig Berger shows how important it is to listen to the world that surrounds us. The film follows him on one of his numerous visits to Morteratsch glacier in the Swiss Alps, where he collects fascinating sounds that might disappear forever. Tomorrow, the Burning Heavens (Max Bloching | Germany | 22 mins 06 secs | German | 2024)This short film explores the 1560s` ‘Little Ice Age’ and its apocalyptic fears, illustrated in hand-coloured woodblock prints. The film juxtaposes these historical anxieties with modern-day artificial winter landscapes in the Alps, created for skiing resorts. By merging past and present, it examines how image-making, technology, and faith interact amidst environmental crises, reflecting on our evolving perceptions of nature and climate change.Disha Swarajyachi (Towards Self-Governance) (Virendra Valsangkar | India | 53 mins 20 secs | Marathi | 2023)Disha Swarajyachi (Towards Self-Governance) is a documentary about a tribal village in Gadchiroli, Maharashtra, known for its consensus-based decision-making. As the first village in India to acquire `Forest Rights,` it has achieved social and financial independence through this practice. The film showcases how this model of working together as a family can be implemented by any community willing to unite and collaborate.Once Upon a Time in a Forest (Virpi Suutari | Finland | 1 hr 33 mins | Finnish, English | 2024)A modern fairy tale set in Finland’s enchanting woodlands, where young people thrive in harmony with nature. As they enjoy the forest`s beauty, 22-year-old Ida leads the Forest Movement against threats from industrial exploitation. The film captures Ida`s inspiring battle to protect the forest and its serene beauty, underscoring the critical conflict between conservation and development.Lullaby of waves (Ayon Pratim Saikia | India | 15 mins 20 secs | Assamese | 2023) A 53-year-old woman reflects on 26 years of marriage and motherhood, focusing on her struggles for employment in Assam’s remote Sadiya region, divided by the Brahmaputra River. Viewed as an outsider, she faced challenges to her home and identity. Narrated by her son, the film explores themes of belonging, resilience, and the enduring impact of the river on their lives as they question whether this land is truly home.Moon Without a House (Atanur Nabiyeva | Azerbaijan | 22 mins 03 secs | Azerbaijani | 2023)Moon Without a House (Atanur Nabiyeva) explores the lives of a grandmother and granddaughter named Tazaghul, who live in a remote Azerbaijani mountain hut. Through serene visuals, the film reveals their deep bond and enduring resilience against a backdrop of desolation. The name "Tazaghul," meaning "fresh flowers," contrasts with their rugged surroundings, symbolising hope and love in isolation. The film poignantly captures their vanishing way of life and emotional strength.Gopi (Nishanth Gurumurthy | India | 13 mins 50 secs | Kannada | 2022)Gopi Siddi is a middle-aged storyteller who identifies herself with the Siddi community (African Diaspora in South India). Inspired by the oral form of storytelling, Gopi desires to get her stories self published; however, she must first face her battles with alienation, social standing, and environmental catastrophe.Searching for soppu: Foraging food in Bengaluru (Ridah Zaman | India | 9 mins 20 secs | Kannada, English | 2024)The Climate Baby Dilemma (Victoria Lean | Canada | 44 mins | English | 2022)The Climate Baby Dilemma follows science writer Britt Wray as she explores the emotional decision of having children amid climate change. Over three years, Britt engages with activists, psychologists, and parents, while many Gen-Z and millennials question bringing a child into an unstable world. The film also features climate-conscious parents like Sarain Fox and Severn Suzuki, offering insights on transforming climate anxiety into action, including the choice to forgo parenthood.Kenya`s Desert Alert (David Owino | Kenya | 15 mins 03 secs | English | 2024)Akunthit (Rahul Barman | India | 15 mins 59 secs | Assamese | 2023)Gopal Nag from Chandamari village in Assam, who lost his lower limbs in a 2014 accident, turned to sustainable farming with his mother’s support. His journey from despair to purpose highlights his resilience and determination. Now, Nag advocates for the disabled to see themselves as specially abled and seek independence, promoting empowerment through equality rather than charity.The Giants (Laurence Billiet, Rachael Antony | Australia | 1 hr 30 mins | English | 2023) The Giants portrays the deep connection between trees and humans through the life of Australian environmental hero and the Australian parliament’s first openly gay member, Bob Brown. The film follows Brown`s journey from a passionate advocate to a central figure in green politics, intertwining his story with the life cycle of the ancient trees he protects. This epic and cinematic film highlights Brown’s activism and sparks urgent conversations about forest preservation and environmental rights.ABBA (Fabiana Lupo | Italy | 14 mins 29 secs | Italian | 2023)A gripping short film that follows two astronauts who land on a planet eerily similar to the Earth their ancestors left behind. Their mission to find water evolves into a profound journey of self-discovery and reflection on humanity`s past. Through stunning visuals and deep narrative, the film explores existential themes of identity, history, and redemption.Some Thoughts on the Common Toad (G. Anthony Svatek | USA | 10 mins 37 secs | English | 2023)A cine-collage manifesto inspired by George Orwell’s essay, with Tilda Swinton narrating. The film uses a blend of images and sound to highlight the common toad as a symbol of natural beauty amidst environmental and political decay. It contrasts the elegance of nature with contemporary issues, urging viewers to reconsider their relationship with the environment and appreciate its beauty and significance.A Flaming Forest (Salman Javeed, Satya Ambasta, Vivek Sangwan | India | 48 mins 27 secs | Kannada, English | 2024)Exclusionary conservation practices in the Biligiri Rangaswamy Temple (BRT) Tiger Reserve have displaced Soliga adivasis from the forests they have historically inhabited. The film documents their intimate relationship with the forest, displacement induced loss and resistance against such policies, calling for an alternative vision to conservation. Akunthit (Rahul Barman | India | 15 mins 59 secs | Assamese | 2023)Gopal Nag from Chandamari village in Assam, who lost his lower limbs in a 2014 accident, turned to sustainable farming with his mother’s support. His journey from despair to purpose highlights his resilience and determination. Now, Nag advocates for the disabled to see themselves as specially abled and seek independence, promoting empowerment through equality rather than charity.Wild Summon (Karni and Saul | UK | 14 mins 39 secs | English | 2023)Wild Summon, directed by Karni and Saul, is a natural history fantasy that portrays the wild salmon`s life cycle in human form. Narrated by Marianne Faithfull, the film follows the salmon`s epic journey from freshwater birth to oceanic adulthood and back. This BFI short film blends myth and nature, offering a unique perspective on the profound connection between these remarkable creatures and their environment.Seed Stories (Chitrangada Choudhury | India | 42 mins | Kui, Odiya, English | 2024) Seed Stories follows Dr. Debal Deb and his team as they conserve over 1,000 endangered heirloom rice varieties in a village in Odisha’s Eastern Ghats. This region, rich in biodiversity and traditional agricultural knowledge, faces transformation due to the introduction of genetically modified seeds and chemicals. The documentary explores how these changes are reshaping local farming practices, food culture, and ecological attitudes, prompting viewers to reflect on sustainability.Burnt Country (Kirsten Slemint | Australia | 17 mins 45 secs | English | 2024)Burnt Country explores Australia`s ancient fire management practices rooted in 65,000 years of Indigenous knowledge. The film highlights how First Nations people use controlled burns to care for the land, contrasting with modern methods. It advocates blending these traditional practices with contemporary fire management to address Australia`s environmental challenges and emphasises the deep connection between Indigenous communities and the landscape.

Together, they strive to secure a future for these endangered amphibians and their environment.Requiem for a Whale (Ido Weisman | Israel | 15 mins 27 secs | Hebrew | 2022)On a stormy night in early 2021, a beached whale washes ashore at Nitzanim Beach, Israel. The film documents the whale’s burial and features phone calls between the director and the witnesses: a photographer, a news reporter, and a Bedouin tractor driver. The encounter with the whale’s corpse evokes the witnesses` thoughts about the dialogue between death and life.The Legend of Goldhorn (Lea Vucko | Slovenia | 13 mins 35 secs | No Dialogue | 2022) A heartbroken hunter, driven by grief and madness, ventures into the mountains, and goes against the mythical power of nature. Haunted by visions of his lost love, he is led by a shadowy guide to hunt the mythical Goldhorn, which ultimately leads to his demise. This 13-minute, dialogue-free film, inspired by Slovenian folklore, explores themes of greed and our relationship with nature, enhanced by a traditional Slavic musical score.Crying Glacier (Lutz Stautner, Philipp Becker | Germany, Switzerland | 14 mins 13 secs | English | 2023)The louder the glacier, the stronger the melt. The creaking, cracking and rippling is the voice of impermanence. Sound artist Ludwig Berger shows how important it is to listen to the world that surrounds us. The film follows him on one of his numerous visits to Morteratsch glacier in the Swiss Alps, where he collects fascinating sounds that might disappear forever. Tomorrow, the Burning Heavens (Max Bloching | Germany | 22 mins 06 secs | German | 2024)This short film explores the 1560s` ‘Little Ice Age’ and its apocalyptic fears, illustrated in hand-coloured woodblock prints. The film juxtaposes these historical anxieties with modern-day artificial winter landscapes in the Alps, created for skiing resorts. By merging past and present, it examines how image-making, technology, and faith interact amidst environmental crises, reflecting on our evolving perceptions of nature and climate change.Disha Swarajyachi (Towards Self-Governance) (Virendra Valsangkar | India | 53 mins 20 secs | Marathi | 2023)Disha Swarajyachi (Towards Self-Governance) is a documentary about a tribal village in Gadchiroli, Maharashtra, known for its consensus-based decision-making. As the first village in India to acquire `Forest Rights,` it has achieved social and financial independence through this practice. The film showcases how this model of working together as a family can be implemented by any community willing to unite and collaborate.Once Upon a Time in a Forest (Virpi Suutari | Finland | 1 hr 33 mins | Finnish, English | 2024)A modern fairy tale set in Finland’s enchanting woodlands, where young people thrive in harmony with nature. As they enjoy the forest`s beauty, 22-year-old Ida leads the Forest Movement against threats from industrial exploitation. The film captures Ida`s inspiring battle to protect the forest and its serene beauty, underscoring the critical conflict between conservation and development.Lullaby of waves (Ayon Pratim Saikia | India | 15 mins 20 secs | Assamese | 2023) A 53-year-old woman reflects on 26 years of marriage and motherhood, focusing on her struggles for employment in Assam’s remote Sadiya region, divided by the Brahmaputra River. Viewed as an outsider, she faced challenges to her home and identity. Narrated by her son, the film explores themes of belonging, resilience, and the enduring impact of the river on their lives as they question whether this land is truly home.Moon Without a House (Atanur Nabiyeva | Azerbaijan | 22 mins 03 secs | Azerbaijani | 2023)Moon Without a House (Atanur Nabiyeva) explores the lives of a grandmother and granddaughter named Tazaghul, who live in a remote Azerbaijani mountain hut. Through serene visuals, the film reveals their deep bond and enduring resilience against a backdrop of desolation. The name "Tazaghul," meaning "fresh flowers," contrasts with their rugged surroundings, symbolising hope and love in isolation. The film poignantly captures their vanishing way of life and emotional strength.Gopi (Nishanth Gurumurthy | India | 13 mins 50 secs | Kannada | 2022)Gopi Siddi is a middle-aged storyteller who identifies herself with the Siddi community (African Diaspora in South India). Inspired by the oral form of storytelling, Gopi desires to get her stories self published; however, she must first face her battles with alienation, social standing, and environmental catastrophe.Searching for soppu: Foraging food in Bengaluru (Ridah Zaman | India | 9 mins 20 secs | Kannada, English | 2024)The Climate Baby Dilemma (Victoria Lean | Canada | 44 mins | English | 2022)The Climate Baby Dilemma follows science writer Britt Wray as she explores the emotional decision of having children amid climate change. Over three years, Britt engages with activists, psychologists, and parents, while many Gen-Z and millennials question bringing a child into an unstable world. The film also features climate-conscious parents like Sarain Fox and Severn Suzuki, offering insights on transforming climate anxiety into action, including the choice to forgo parenthood.Kenya`s Desert Alert (David Owino | Kenya | 15 mins 03 secs | English | 2024)Akunthit (Rahul Barman | India | 15 mins 59 secs | Assamese | 2023)Gopal Nag from Chandamari village in Assam, who lost his lower limbs in a 2014 accident, turned to sustainable farming with his mother’s support. His journey from despair to purpose highlights his resilience and determination. Now, Nag advocates for the disabled to see themselves as specially abled and seek independence, promoting empowerment through equality rather than charity.The Giants (Laurence Billiet, Rachael Antony | Australia | 1 hr 30 mins | English | 2023) The Giants portrays the deep connection between trees and humans through the life of Australian environmental hero and the Australian parliament’s first openly gay member, Bob Brown. The film follows Brown`s journey from a passionate advocate to a central figure in green politics, intertwining his story with the life cycle of the ancient trees he protects. This epic and cinematic film highlights Brown’s activism and sparks urgent conversations about forest preservation and environmental rights.ABBA (Fabiana Lupo | Italy | 14 mins 29 secs | Italian | 2023)A gripping short film that follows two astronauts who land on a planet eerily similar to the Earth their ancestors left behind. Their mission to find water evolves into a profound journey of self-discovery and reflection on humanity`s past. Through stunning visuals and deep narrative, the film explores existential themes of identity, history, and redemption.Some Thoughts on the Common Toad (G. Anthony Svatek | USA | 10 mins 37 secs | English | 2023)A cine-collage manifesto inspired by George Orwell’s essay, with Tilda Swinton narrating. The film uses a blend of images and sound to highlight the common toad as a symbol of natural beauty amidst environmental and political decay. It contrasts the elegance of nature with contemporary issues, urging viewers to reconsider their relationship with the environment and appreciate its beauty and significance.A Flaming Forest (Salman Javeed, Satya Ambasta, Vivek Sangwan | India | 48 mins 27 secs | Kannada, English | 2024)Exclusionary conservation practices in the Biligiri Rangaswamy Temple (BRT) Tiger Reserve have displaced Soliga adivasis from the forests they have historically inhabited. The film documents their intimate relationship with the forest, displacement induced loss and resistance against such policies, calling for an alternative vision to conservation. Akunthit (Rahul Barman | India | 15 mins 59 secs | Assamese | 2023)Gopal Nag from Chandamari village in Assam, who lost his lower limbs in a 2014 accident, turned to sustainable farming with his mother’s support. His journey from despair to purpose highlights his resilience and determination. Now, Nag advocates for the disabled to see themselves as specially abled and seek independence, promoting empowerment through equality rather than charity.Wild Summon (Karni and Saul | UK | 14 mins 39 secs | English | 2023)Wild Summon, directed by Karni and Saul, is a natural history fantasy that portrays the wild salmon`s life cycle in human form. Narrated by Marianne Faithfull, the film follows the salmon`s epic journey from freshwater birth to oceanic adulthood and back. This BFI short film blends myth and nature, offering a unique perspective on the profound connection between these remarkable creatures and their environment.Seed Stories (Chitrangada Choudhury | India | 42 mins | Kui, Odiya, English | 2024) Seed Stories follows Dr. Debal Deb and his team as they conserve over 1,000 endangered heirloom rice varieties in a village in Odisha’s Eastern Ghats. This region, rich in biodiversity and traditional agricultural knowledge, faces transformation due to the introduction of genetically modified seeds and chemicals. The documentary explores how these changes are reshaping local farming practices, food culture, and ecological attitudes, prompting viewers to reflect on sustainability.Burnt Country (Kirsten Slemint | Australia | 17 mins 45 secs | English | 2024)Burnt Country explores Australia`s ancient fire management practices rooted in 65,000 years of Indigenous knowledge. The film highlights how First Nations people use controlled burns to care for the land, contrasting with modern methods. It advocates blending these traditional practices with contemporary fire management to address Australia`s environmental challenges and emphasises the deep connection between Indigenous communities and the landscape.

name: ALT EFF 2024 x MEDAI : The Stage
description: Since the dawn of time, storytelling in community has shaped our mindset, our outlook and ultimately, our behaviour. With record heat, oscillating droughts & floods, fires, melting glaciers (and ... you know the rest) our current narrative needs some course correcting.All Living Things Environmental Film Festival (ALT EFF) is back for a 5th edition, pan-India cultural event. Join us at MEDAI for a unique evening of cinema, art & community. Watch award-winning global films on regeneration, activism, resilience and hope and engage in conversations with India’s most inspiring change-makers. Let’s restore the narrative of stewardship, together. name: In the footsteps of the Tiger of Mysore.
description: Discover the history of Bangalore fort, its tales of glory & treachery over the past five centuries with us.The walk begins with a vegetarian breakfast. After that we take our guests to explore the remnants of Tipu's summer palace, the Bangalore fort & the armory.During the course of the walk learn how Anglo-French wars in Europe & North America had their impact in Southern India too.The guests get to learn more about Tipu's weapons on mass destruction of the 18th century & how they influenced the US national anthem & how one small Southern Indian kingdom was a thorn in the East India Company's rule.

name: Malleswara Darshan heritage walk.
description: This is our walk in one of the oldest suburbs of the "old Bangalore". Join us on a 'darshan' of the many temples and other religious institutes that dot this area as we narrate to you its origins and about the celebrities/personalities who called it their 'home'. Also on this walk learn more about the Maratha connection to this neighborhood as well as how a philanthropist not only helped renovate the Kadu Malleswara temple but also helped create an entire lake in the days gone by.See how Kadu Malleswara turned into a "Mall-e-swarm" and is fast losing not only it's heritage structures but also its local culture. In between all the bytes of history we take bites from an iconic eatery in the this area.So join us on this walk next and get to know Malleswaram in a completely new light.

name: Introduction to Tai Chi with Meera
description: Are you someone who believes in exploring meditation in daily life through movement? Tai Chi is an ancient Chinese martial art and mind-body practice known for its slow, flowing movements, which promotes relaxation, balance, and inner peace. Rooted in principles of mindfulness and energy flow, it combines gentle physical movements with relaxed breathing and focused awareness, making it both a form of physical exercise and moving meditation.Join Meera Krishna who has been learning and practicing Tai Chi for the last 17 years. She has facilitated and taught the art for 8 years. Meera Krishna believes her life's calling is to facilitate health and conscious living through Tai Chi ( movement meditation) and Zen art as tools to be healthy, to connect with one's body, understand the mind, explore one's daily life, freeing one's spirit and reclaiming one's natural joyful state of well-being in sync with nature.Few of the many benefits of this workshop includes : Exploring movements to feel energetic, experiencing body awareness & relaxation and a renewed outlook on exploring well-being and healthy living.Kindly ensure to have breakfast 2.5 hours prior to the session and wear loose comfortable cotton clothes, not tight fit.

name: OTJF Listening Sessions: Kraftwerk - The Man Machine - Bengaluru
description: Join us at the library at Goethe Institut/Max Mueller Bhavan, Indiranagar as we journey through one of the most groundbreaking albums of all time—The Man-Machine by Kraftwerk. Hosted by On The Jungle Floor, this event invites you to explore the sleek, futuristic sounds that helped define electronic music and continue to shape modern soundscapes. On the 10th of November, from 4 PM onwards, immerse yourself in the world of the German Electronic Quartet, Kraftwerk, through their 1978 release, The Man Machine. From the mechanical pulse of "The Robots" to the sprawling industrial beauty of "Metropolis" and the hypnotic rhythms of "The Model," we'll spin The Man-Machine in its entirety on vinyl, capturing the fusion of man and machine that made this album a cornerstone of electronic music.Joining us as co-host is illustrator and musician, Sachin Bhatt. Specializing in album art and visual creatives, Sachin has made a significant impact locally and internationally, having worked with artists like Hiatus Kaiyote, Moonchild, The F16s, Kiefer and more.Whether you're an electronic music aficionado or you’re new to Kraftwerk, you’re sure to enjoy this evening of beats, exploration, and deep listening.

name: Screening: The Perks of Being a Wallflower (2012) | Movie Under the Stars
description: Join us for an open-air screening of The Perks of Being a Wallflower (2012), with a three-course dinner and popcorn.*Wines and other beverages will be available for purchase at the venue.About the movieThe Perks of Being a Wallflower follows the story of Charlie, an introverted high school freshman who struggles with mental health issues and traumatic memories from his past. As he begins his first year of high school, he feels isolated and lost until he befriends two charismatic seniors, Sam and her stepbrother Patrick. With their help, Charlie begins to open up, discovering friendship, love, and acceptance.Set in the early 1990s, the film delves into themes of mental health, trauma, and the impact of relationships, capturing the highs and lows of teenage life. Through the course of the story, Charlie learns to embrace his experiences and his unique perspective, ultimately finding his voice. Based on Stephen Chbosky’s bestselling novel, the story is a powerful exploration of self-discovery and resilience.3-Course Dinner MenuCourse 1Nachos with bean chili & cheese dipCourse 2Macaroni & cheese served with potatoes wedges & garlic bread (Veg.)Baked Ziti, pasta baked with chicken, marinara sauce & cheese, Served with potatoes wedges & garlic bread (Non-Veg.)Course 3Devil food cake with red wine & cherries______Terms and ConditionsThe management is not responsible for any injury or damage that may occur during the event.No liability or claims arising from the consumption or intake of any food or drink will be entertained by the management.Parking near the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.Valet service is available at a charge of Rs. 200 per vehicle.Photographs and videos of ticket holders may be uploaded to social media. If you prefer not to be featured, please inform our team.Tickets are non-refundable in case of cancellation or no-show.In case of rain, the event will be moved indoors.

name: Cultivating Wealth Wellness: A Workshop for Lifelong Prosperity
description: Picture your finances as a well-cultivated ecosystem, where each element—income, savings, investments, and community—works together to support balance and resilience. In this interactive workshop, we’ll build on the strengths you already have, focusing on strategies that align with your priorities for long-term stability and a meaningful legacy. Led by financial expert Anu Seth, this session brings practical insights, guided reflections, and tools to help you nurture your financial ecosystem in ways that grow with you.What Makes This Workshop SpecialThis experience goes beyond traditional planning. Together, we’ll reimagine financial wellness as an adaptable, living ecosystem—one that supports your evolving goals and ensures lasting security for you and those you care about. You’ll get practical insights, relatable examples, and a creative approach to enhance your financial journey, without being bogged down in jargon or rigid plans.Workshop Highlights🌞 Fresh Perspectives: Step back and view your financial landscape holistically, discovering how each part of your ecosystem contributes to its strength and stability.🌱 Mapping Your Financial Ecosystem: Identify and map key elements in your financial life, exploring how these parts work together to provide support now and in the future.💧 Guidance from Anu Seth: Gain accessible, practical insights to deepen your existing financial habits, adapting them to meet both current and future needs.🌿 Tailored Takeaways: Define actionable steps to strengthen your financial ecosystem, backed by resources that will continue to support your journey well into the future.Why You Should AttendIf you’re looking to enhance your approach to financial wellness, this workshop offers a unique opportunity to build on your knowledge, refine your strategies, and shape a legacy that reflects your values. Walk away with insights and tools tailored for a more resilient, balanced financial future.

organizer.description: Zuva Life is redefining what it means to thrive across the life continuum. By rethinking purpose and reimagining living, we offer experiences that inspire people to rediscover their passions and build meaningful communities.

name: Yoga + Brunch at the Studio with Asan Cup
description: Thursday Mornings Done Right!Join us for a 60-minute session with Sukriti Rai—a blend of yoga flows designed around women's reproductive health. Wherever you are in your cycle, this flow will energise and support you. After the class, we’ll gather for a delicious brunch featuring a nourishing brunch for hormonal health that feature smoothies, nourishing salads, and seeded energy balls. Come for the workout, stay for the brunch, and find your community. Ira, Founder of Asan Cup, will be giving a talk about menstrual health and period cups and all attendees will get one Asan cup each! Leave feeling nourished—inside and out.This is a women's only event because it centred around period-health.

name: The Kongunadu Craving
description: As our next pop-up, we bring to you The Kongunadu Craving by Chef HarshiniWith a family deeply connected to food, Chef Harshini learnt Kongunaducuisine from the recipes passed on to her through generations of extraordinary cooks in the family. She pursued culinary training at Le Cordon Blu in London and later contributed to family venture in coimbatore and helped shape menus for restaurants like Kovai Alankar Vilas. Kongu cuisine encompasses flavours from Coimbatore, Erode, Selam and very different from the more popular peppery spices of Chettinad cuisine.MENUWelcome DrinkNannari Sarbath with Basil SeedsAmuse Bouche Appam blinis with quail egg and Moily sauce (Non Veg)Ammini Podi Kozhukattai with Gun Powder and Poondu Chutney (veg)StartersVegetarian Mushroom Pallipalayam in Coin ParottaVaazhaippo Vadai with Puli InjiNon VegetarianMutton Chintamani in Coin ParathaMettur Kal Meen Varuval (Curry leaves and Coconut oil)Main CourseVegetarianKari Pazha Kulambu with Vendhaya IdlyMalli sadham with Malli chutney and coconut pachidiNon VegetarianNaati Kozhi kulambu with Vendhaya Idly Kongu Mutton Biriyani with Raitha & Kathirikai PachadiDessertsWarm - Karupatti halwa Chilled – Ilaneer PayasamAccompanimentsGooseberry Chutney, Radish Chutney, Poondu ChutneyTerms & Conditions:Please arrive punctually.Late arrivals may miss the first few courses.Booking Fee are non-refundable under all circumstances once booked. Tickets are transferrable to a third party.No shows/ cancellations will not be refunded, but you can reschedule your booking for within the week 48hrs before your slot is due.Alcohol will not be served to guests under the age of 21No liability or claims that may arise due to the consumption or intake of any food or drink will be entertained by the management.The booking fee total includes the online transaction fee.Parking at the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.Valet is available.Photographs and videos of ticket holders may be uploaded to social media. Incase you do not wish to be featured, let our team know.

name: A STORY WALK through INDIRANAGAR , Bengaluru
description: A STORY WALK through INDIRA NAGAR (Bengaluru)On a Sunday morning , Walk through the lanes of INDIRA NAGAR with Vikram Sridhar discovering the lanes through the Folklore , Heritage and Ecology of the area . The walk will begin and culminate at ATTA GALATTA . The tales will revolve around historical , mythical and personal narratives weaved as we discover the area through the walk . Time : 7 AM Starting Point : Atta Galatta

name: TALES of Bengaluru : Family Storytelling time
description: Children , Parents and lovers of Bangalore's lores  TALES OF BENGALURU : Travel into the world of tales of our wonderful city , set amidst the RBANM's School in Halasuru , a heritage premises that goes back in time of more than 100 yrs . With 10+ Storytellers , spread over 2 hours , the children , adults and parents will time travel into the lores of our city.From Trees to Buildings to Writers to many more.BSS in association with the INTACH (Bengaluru Chapter)  Venue : RBANM's School , Halasuru Time : 11 AM to 1 PM  Date : 9th Nov (Saturday)  Age : 5 yrs +    Details : 9945799224                                                                   Location : https://maps.app.goo.gl/scW8UBuWZsbwKmzL8 Ticket : https://in.bookmyshow.com/plays/tales-of-bengaluru/ET00417930

name: RR Biryani Lunch Thali
description: Join us for a delightful lunch experience that brings together the rich, aromatic flavors of Andhra cuisine at Salt & Pepper Kitchen's exclusive RR Thali Lunch event! Dive into a feast that celebrates tradition, spice, and the comfort of a hearty meal.Menu Highlights:Main Course: Authentic Andhra Biryani, bursting with bold spices and tender rice.Starters/Sides: Enjoy three carefully curated starters and sides that add layers of flavour to your thali.Accompaniments:Crispy, golden Papad.Refreshing Raita to cool your palate.Flavorful Salan that perfectly complements the biryani.Beverage: A chilled soft drink to wash down the flavors and complete your meal.Don't miss this special event where food meets comfort and flavor. Reserve your table for the RR Thali Lunch and indulge in a memorable culinary journey!

This Friday we are opening out the space beyond our members, for an open-day with a delicious, nourishing 'fill-your-plate' spread !Nourish yourself at our ‘all you can eat’ deli counter and work from our beautiful cafe/co-working space at the Studio that is normally a members-only space!

name: Enjoy Sunday Breakfast with Strangers
description: Ready to kickstart your day with a delightful twist? 🌞 Join us for a Breakfast with Strangers Table at Maverick & Farmer, where exceptional breakfast meets great company!Maverick & Farmer is known for its cozy, charming ambiance and its diverse egg options that cater to every taste. From classic Eggs Benedict 🍳 to indulgent fluffy omelettes, you’ll be treated to a breakfast feast that’s as delightful as it is satisfying. And don’t miss their exceptional coffee ☕—perfect for energizing your morning and setting the tone for a fantastic day ahead.At our Breakfast Table, we believe in the magic of meeting new faces over a delicious meal. This is your chance to step out of your comfort zone, spark engaging conversations, and perhaps make some new friends along the way. 🤝Whether you’re new to the city, looking to expand your social circle, or just enjoy making new connections, this breakfast is for you. We’ll provide the mouthwatering food, the inviting atmosphere, and plenty of conversation starters.Just bring yourself and an open mind! 🌟Can’t wait to see you at Maverick & Farmer for a morning of great food and even better company! 🎉🍽️

You might just meet your new best friend or future partner-in-crime! The vibe is all about having fun, making unforgettable connections, and soaking in the weekend energy. With good drinks and great company, this is one night you won’t forget!

name: Enjoy a Bento box & Conversations with Strangers
description: Ready for a night of bites and banter?Let Wednesday be your midweek pitstop to recharge 🏁🔋.Join us at Bento Bento 🎏, where strangers become friends!Feeling like it’s time to spice up your social life and your taste buds? 🥢🍣 Book your table and treat yourself to an epic Pan Asian feast—each bite is like a mini-vacation across Asia! @bentobento.bangalore is the perfect place to let loose and enjoy a cozy K-drama-inspired spot that’s got all the vibes you didn’t know you needed. ✨What happens when you mix mouthwatering food with great conversation? Magic. This isn’t just dinner—it’s your chance to embark on a wholesome culinary adventure and make new friends.So come hungry, come curious, and leave with a full belly and a few new buddies. Let’s turn strangers into friends—one sushi roll at a time!

name: The Breakfast Club 2.0
description: Muro Café Launches with a 3-Day Coffee Festival and Asian Breakfast CelebrationWe’re excited to invite you to an exclusive breakfast and coffee preview of Muro Café, where Bangalore will experience the best of Asian breakfast and a three-day celebration of Single Origin Coffees of Karnataka’s finest coffee estates. Join us on November 8, 9, and 10 (Friday-Sunday) for a preview of our breakfast menu and join us in celebrating the rich flavours and stories behind exceptional coffee.From 9 a.m. to 12:00 p.m., experience Muro Cafe's unique twist on breakfast; from rich Crab Omelettes and indulgent Hong Kong French Toast to creamy Basque Cheesecake & more.Our expert partners from Ratnagiri, Balanoor, and Devarkhan Estates will join us to showcase the distinct flavours of each estate’s coffee, guiding you through a masterclass that brings the artistry of coffee to life. Learn about the journey from bean to brew, and discover how to elevate your own morning ritual. Celebrate food, community, and the joy of coming together. Muro: https://www.instagram.com/murocafeblr/
